author: "James Browne"
date: "March 29, 2017"
output: html_document
---

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE, warning=FALSE, error=FALSE, message=FALSE, cache = FALSE)
source('~/dropbox/gitRepos/R-RerF/rfr_function.R')
```
This iteration removes some redundant look-ups in the find best split function, implements the predict function, and changes the error_rate function to use the newly implemented predict function. 
**********************************************************************
#### 10 runs iris, trees=100, min node=6, mtry=0
**********************************************************************
```{r run-iris, cache = FALSE}
#prepare data
X <- as.matrix(iris[,1:4])
Y <- as.numeric(iris[,5])
ptmtrain <- NA
ptmtest <- NA
error <- NA
for (i in 1:10){
ptm <- proc.time()
forest<-rfr(X,Y) 
ptmtrain[i]<- (proc.time() - ptm)[3]
ptm <- proc.time()
error[i] <- error_rate(X,Y,forest)
ptmtest[i]<- (proc.time() - ptm)[3]
}
cat("iris training complete:\nTraining Time Summary\n")
summary(ptmtrain)
cat("iris error complete:\nError Summary:\n")
summary(error)
cat("Test Time Summary:\n")
summary(ptmtest)
```
